ANU.name: Edward Deveson
interest: My current research interests focus on the history of biological sciences in Australia, in particular the development of the fields of entomology, agricultural science, botany and ecology during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries.
project: Ted is currently collaborating on several data-driven research projects that use the accumulated locust surveillance databases of the APLC and the FAO to model outbreaks and improve forecasts of different locust species in relation to numerous environmental parameters. The approaches include generalised additive and hierarchical modelling and machine learning techniques.

He is a member of the Global Locust Initiative, a worldwide collaboration led by the Arizona State University School of Sustainability to develop and foster eco-sociological and more sustainable methods for the management of locust outbreaks and plagues.
